channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: EHRSQL: A Practical Text-to-SQL Benchmark for Electronic Health Records
item.description: We present a new text-to-SQL dataset for electronic health records (EHRs), where the utterances are collected from 222 hospital staffâ€”including physicians, nurses, insurance review and health records teams, and more.

item.title: From Coarse to Fine: Hierarchical Pixel Integration for Lightweight Image Super-Resolution
item.description: In the fine area, we use an Intra-Patch Self-Attention (IPSA) module to model long-range pixel dependencies in a local patch, and then a $3\times3$ convolution is applied to process the finest details.

item.title: Protein Language Models and Structure Prediction: Connection and Progression
item.description: The prediction of protein structures from sequences is an important task for function prediction, drug design, and related biological processes understanding.

item.title: GeoUDF: Surface Reconstruction from 3D Point Clouds via Geometry-guided Distance Representation
item.description: We conduct extensive experiments and ablation studies to demonstrate the significant advantages of our method over state-of-the-art methods in terms of reconstruction accuracy, efficiency, and generalizability.

item.title: MLC at HECKTOR 2022: The Effect and Importance of Training Data when Analyzing Cases of Head and Neck Tumors using Machine Learning
item.description: We proposed two approaches; one using only the CT scans to make predictions and another using a combination of the CT and PET scans.

item.title: Directed Acyclic Graph Structure Learning from Dynamic Graphs
item.description: In a dynamic graph, we propose to simultaneously estimate contemporaneous relationships and time-lagged interaction relationships between the node features.

item.title: Multiresolution Textual Inversion
item.description: We extend Textual Inversion to learn pseudo-words that represent a concept at different resolutions.

item.title: Towards Improving Exploration in Self-Imitation Learning using Intrinsic Motivation
item.description: Unfortunately, in a broad range of problems the design of a good reward function is not trivial, so in such cases sparse reward signals are instead adopted.

item.title: Towards Interpreting Vulnerability of Multi-Instance Learning via Customized and Universal Adversarial Perturbations
item.description: The safety of MIL learners is concerning, though, as we can greatly fool them by introducing a few adversarial perturbations.

item.title: NOPE-SAC: Neural One-Plane RANSAC for Sparse-View Planar 3D Reconstruction
item.description: This paper studies the challenging two-view 3D reconstruction in a rigorous sparse-view configuration, which is suffering from insufficient correspondences in the input image pairs for camera pose estimation.

item.title: WeatherFusionNet: Predicting Precipitation from Satellite Data
item.description: WeatherFusionNet is a U-Net architecture that fuses three different ways to process the satellite data; predicting future satellite frames, extracting rain information from the current frames, and using the input sequence directly.

item.title: Automated anomaly-aware 3D segmentation of bones and cartilages in knee MR images from the Osteoarthritis Initiative
item.description: A second anomaly-aware network, which was compared to anomaly-na\"ive segmentation networks, was used to provide a final automated segmentation of the femoral, tibial and patellar bones and cartilages from the knee MR images containing a spectrum of bone anomalies.

item.title: Fair Ranking with Noisy Protected Attributes
item.description: The fair-ranking problem, which asks to rank a given set of items to maximize utility subject to group fairness constraints, has received attention in the fairness, information retrieval, and machine learning literature.

item.title: Learning Motion-Robust Remote Photoplethysmography through Arbitrary Resolution Videos
item.description: Remote photoplethysmography (rPPG) enables non-contact heart rate (HR) estimation from facial videos which gives significant convenience compared with traditional contact-based measurements.

item.title: AIO-P: Expanding Neural Performance Predictors Beyond Image Classification
item.description: Evaluating neural network performance is critical to deep neural network design but a costly procedure.

item.title: Weisfeiler and Leman Go Relational
item.description: Namely, we investigate the limitations in the expressive power of the well-known Relational GCN and Compositional GCN architectures and shed some light on their practical learning performance.

item.title: BEVPoolv2: A Cutting-edge Implementation of BEVDet Toward Deployment
item.description: We offer an example of deployment to the TensorRT backend in branch dev2. 0 and show how fast the BEVDet paradigm can be processed on it.

item.title: SafeSpace MFNet: Precise and Efficient MultiFeature Drone Detection Network
item.description: To overcome these limitations, we propose a precise and efficient multiscale and multifeature UAV detection network for SafeSpace, i. e., \textit{MultiFeatureNet} (\textit{MFNet}), an improved version of the popular object detection algorithm YOLOv5s.

item.title: EURO: ESPnet Unsupervised ASR Open-source Toolkit
item.description: This paper describes the ESPnet Unsupervised ASR Open-source Toolkit (EURO), an end-to-end open-source toolkit for unsupervised automatic speech recognition (UASR).

item.title: CDSM: Cascaded Deep Semantic Matching on Textual Graphs Leveraging Ad-hoc Neighbor Selection
item.description: In the first stage, a lightweight CNN-based ad-hod neighbor selector is deployed to filter useful neighbors for the matching task with a small computation cost.

item.title: Bi-directional Feature Reconstruction Network for Fine-Grained Few-Shot Image Classification
item.description: Conventional few-shot learning methods however cannot be naively adopted for this fine-grained setting -- a quick pilot study reveals that they in fact push for the opposite (i. e., lower inter-class variations and higher intra-class variations).

item.title: Towards Training GNNs using Explanation Directed Message Passing
item.description: With the increasing use of Graph Neural Networks (GNNs) in critical real-world applications, several post hoc explanation methods have been proposed to understand their predictions.

item.title: Geoclidean: Few-Shot Generalization in Euclidean Geometry
item.description: In contrast, low-level and high-level visual features from standard computer vision models pretrained on natural images do not support correct generalization.

item.title: Robust and Fast Measure of Information via Low-rank Representation
item.description: The matrix-based R\'enyi's entropy allows us to directly quantify information measures from given data, without explicit estimation of the underlying probability distribution.

item.title: Predicting Properties of Quantum Systems with Conditional Generative Models
item.description: Alternatively, kernel methods can predict local observables by learning from measurements on different but related states.

item.title: ConvLab-3: A Flexible Dialogue System Toolkit Based on a Unified Data Format
item.description: To address this issue, we present ConvLab-3, a flexible dialogue system toolkit based on a unified TOD data format.

item.title: Self-Emphasizing Network for Continuous Sign Language Recognition
item.description: To relieve this problem, we propose a self-emphasizing network (SEN) to emphasize informative spatial regions in a self-motivated way, with few extra computations and without additional expensive supervision.

item.title: Rephrasing the Reference for Non-Autoregressive Machine Translation
item.description: In response to this problem, we introduce a rephraser to provide a better training target for NAT by rephrasing the reference sentence according to the NAT output.

item.title: How to Train an Accurate and Efficient Object Detection Model on Any Dataset
item.description: To solve this, we propose an alternative approach that also forms a backbone of Intel Geti platform: a dataset-agnostic template for object detection trainings, consisting of carefully chosen and pre-trained models together with a robust training pipeline for further training.

item.title: ExtremeBERT: A Toolkit for Accelerating Pretraining of Customized BERT
item.description: In this paper, we present ExtremeBERT, a toolkit for accelerating and customizing BERT pretraining.

item.title: GENNAPE: Towards Generalized Neural Architecture Performance Estimators
item.description: In this paper, we propose GENNAPE, a Generalized Neural Architecture Performance Estimator, which is pretrained on open neural architecture benchmarks, and aims to generalize to completely unseen architectures through combined innovations in network representation, contrastive pretraining, and fuzzy clustering-based predictor ensemble.

item.title: NeAF: Learning Neural Angle Fields for Point Normal Estimation
item.description: To resolve these issues, we propose an implicit function to learn an angle field around the normal of each point in the spherical coordinate system, which is dubbed as Neural Angle Fields (NeAF).

item.title: CREPE: Open-Domain Question Answering with False Presuppositions
item.description: We find that 25% of questions contain false presuppositions, and provide annotations for these presuppositions and their corrections.

item.title: Zero-Shot Opinion Summarization with GPT-3
item.description: Very large language models such as GPT-3 have shown impressive performance across a wide variety of tasks, including text summarization.

item.title: End-to-End Neural Discourse Deixis Resolution in Dialogue
item.description: We adapt Lee et al.'s (2018) span-based entity coreference model to the task of end-to-end discourse deixis resolution in dialogue, specifically by proposing extensions to their model that exploit task-specific characteristics.

item.title: An Extreme-Adaptive Time Series Prediction Model Based on Probability-Enhanced LSTM Neural Networks
item.description: Forecasting time series with extreme events has been a challenging and prevalent research topic, especially when the time series data are affected by complicated uncertain factors, such as is the case in hydrologic prediction.

item.title: Measuring the Measuring Tools: An Automatic Evaluation of Semantic Metrics for Text Corpora
item.description: The ability to compare the semantic similarity between text corpora is important in a variety of natural language processing applications.

item.title: Graph Neural Networks: A Powerful and Versatile Tool for Advancing Design, Reliability, and Security of ICs
item.description: Graph neural networks (GNNs) have pushed the state-of-the-art (SOTA) for performance in learning and predicting on large-scale data present in social networks, biology, etc.

item.title: Disentangling the Mechanisms Behind Implicit Regularization in SGD
item.description: A number of competing hypotheses have been proposed to explain why small-batch Stochastic Gradient Descent (SGD)leads to improved generalization over the full-batch regime, with recent work crediting the implicit regularization of various quantities throughout training.

item.title: Lifelong Person Re-Identification via Knowledge Refreshing and Consolidation
item.description: Lifelong person re-identification (LReID) is in significant demand for real-world development as a large amount of ReID data is captured from diverse locations over time and cannot be accessed at once inherently.

item.title: Synthetic data enable experiments in atomistic machine learning
item.description: The cheapness of this process, compared to the quantum-mechanical ground truth, allows us to generate millions of datapoints, in turn enabling rapid experimentation with atomistic ML models from the small- to the large-data regime.

item.title: A Revenue Function for Comparison-Based Hierarchical Clustering
item.description: Comparison-based learning addresses the problem of learning when, instead of explicit features or pairwise similarities, one only has access to comparisons of the form: \emph{Object $A$ is more similar to $B$ than to $C$.}

item.title: Behavior Estimation from Multi-Source Data for Offline Reinforcement Learning
item.description: To overcome this drawback, the present study proposes a latent variable model to infer a set of policies from data, which allows an agent to use as behavior policy the policy that best describes a particular trajectory.

item.title: Taming a Generative Model
item.description: Our method can be used in the context of privacy, e. g., removing a specific person from the output of a model, and also in the context of de-biasing by forcing a model to output specific image categories according to a given target distribution.

item.title: ACE: Cooperative Multi-agent Q-learning with Bidirectional Action-Dependency
item.description: In the learning phase, each agent minimizes the TD error that is dependent on how the subsequent agents have reacted to their chosen action.

item.title: Extending the Subwording Model of Multilingual Pretrained Models for New Languages
item.description: Multilingual pretrained models are effective for machine translation and cross-lingual processing because they contain multiple languages in one model.

item.title: Peano: Learning Formal Mathematical Reasoning
item.description: We explore this idea in a case study on 5 sections of beginning algebra on the Khan Academy platform.

item.title: Bayesian Simultaneous Factorization and Prediction Using Multi-Omic Data
item.description: We show via simulation that BSFP is competitive in recovering latent variation structure, as well as the importance of propagating uncertainty from the estimated factorization to prediction.

item.title: Robustness Disparities in Face Detection
item.description: Many existing algorithmic audits examine the performance of these systems on later stage elements of facial analysis systems like facial recognition and age, emotion, or perceived gender prediction; however, a core component to these systems has been vastly understudied from a fairness perspective: face detection, sometimes called face localization.

item.title: Guiding Neural Entity Alignment with Compatibility
item.description: Making compatible predictions thus should be one of the goals of training an EA model along with fitting the labelled data: this aspect however is neglected in current methods.
